conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from points A, B, C, and D using the provided images.
From point A, the liquid flows downward and encounters the first baffle (a yellow horizontal bar).
The liquid continues flowing along the baffle towards the right.
The liquid hits another baffle (a brown diagonal bar).
The brown diagonal baffle directs the liquid further downwards.
The liquid eventually reaches the bottom left side, leading to container E.
From point B, the liquid flows downward and hits the same yellow horizontal baffle as from point A.
Following the baffle, the liquid moves towards the right and encounters the same brown diagonal baffle.
This directs the liquid downwards, similar to the flow from point A, leading it to container E.
From point C, the liquid hits the yellow baffle.
The liquid moves right and encounters the brown diagonal baffle.
The liquid is directed downwards and ends up in container E.
From point D, the liquid flows directly downwards without hitting any baffles initially.
The liquid encounters the gray diagonal baffle on the right.
The gray baffle directs the liquid towards the bottom right, leading it to container F.
Points A, B, and C: The liquid flows into container E.
Point D: The liquid flows into container F.
The liquid from points A, B, and C will flow into container E, while the liquid from point D will flow into container F.
